catalog_info.title: Galactic and Extragalactic Astronomy
catalog_info.notes: This course, when taken for a letter grade, meets the General Education requirement for Science of the Physical Universe. This course is offered each year.
catalog_info.prereq: Prerequisite: An introductory course in mechanics, which may be taken concurrently, satisfied by Physics 15a, Physics16, or Physical Sciences 12a.REQ; Astronomy 17
catalog_info.description: This course provides an introduction to the physical principles describing galaxies and the composition and evolution of the Universe. Topics include the interstellar medium; star clusters; the structure and dynamics of the Milky Way; other galaxies; clusters of galaxies; active galaxies and quasars; cosmology; and the early universe. This course includes an observational component: In addition to observing galaxies with the Science Center Clay Telescope, students will use the millimeter-wavelength telescope at the Harvard-Smithsonian Center for Astrophysics to measure the rotation velocity of the Milky Way galaxy and to determine its mass.
